p.s: In the following the format and poetic devices used byShakespeare in his sonnet in order to illustrate his view is going to be analysed.
To begin with structure, Sonnet 138 is a typical Shakespearean sonnet divideddevided into three quatrains, each concluding four lines, and at the end there is aan ending couplet.
The three quatrains are written in cross rhyme abab cdcd efef and the ending couplet in pair rhyme gg.

Furthermore, the famous metrical pattern by Shakespearean sonnets iambic pentameter is also use by him in this sonnet, which sounds like a heartbeat and it strengentsstrengthens the feeling of love for the reader.
This usual Shakespearean rules that also Sonnet 138 follows makes his sonnet more understandable and easier for the reader, as this is typical of Shakespeare's sonnets.

The Volta or turn, which can be found in line 9 and can be signalized by the word But [...] (l. 9) or yet, makes already the poem more interesting for the reader, because it usually changes the meaning or the message.

Not only in the given sonnet, but also in most of Shakespeare's sonnets is the ending couplet known as the conclusion, which wether answers the question asked in the sonnet, or it summarizes the sonnet as an ending.

Regarding the use stylistic devices in the given sonnet, the author emphasizes in the first and second line When my love sweats [...] I know she lies enjambment, which makes clear that the speaker's beloved person is lying in their relationship.
This is aan exciting start of the sonnet for the reader.
In addition to, the hyperbelhyperbole simply I credit her false speaking tongue (l. 7) means that even the speaker knows about the lies, he does not mind it.
This strengthens the poetic feeling of love because the reader understands how much the speaker is in love with his beloved person.

In line 9 and 10, the author utilizes repetition wherefore (l. 9), wherefore (l. 10) in order to keep the sonnet interesting for the reader by asking the questions, which is an interior monologue of the speaker because he asks himself.
All in all, as one can realize that W. Shakespeare sonnet is alive because of the always used feeling of love.
The findings of the speaker are clear and they are underlined by the devices used by the author.
Like always, not only the given sonnet but also most of the Shakespearean sonnets touch the the reader's heart.
